title: Cannot send outgoing email from Thunderbird desktop for Windows
content:
Using Thunderbird desktop for Windows with my Hotmail account, I frequently cannot send an outgoing email. I regularly get the following message even while successfully receiving incoming messages.

Send Message Error Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: Cannot connect to SMTP server 2603:1036:308:2817::2 (2603:1036:308:2817::2:587), connect error 10060.

I use Thunderbird for Android with the same email account without any issues. Any thoughts?
creator: jeffswan252

title: Remove Dashed Border around Compose Window? 137.0.2 (64-bit)
content:

Is there a setting to remove it? Perhaps I can tweak the CSS to make the color match the background so it disappears?

title: thunderbird malfunction with Xfinity
content: This has happened before and was only solved by deleting every possible thunderbird element from my laptop, (including my calendar, which later took many hours to re - update). An email from xfinity that includes a link to my xfinity account attaches itself to my tbird program in such a way that no new emails can be received. I have cleaned the cache, opened task manager and closed every tbird open link, I have removed all xfinity emails on the original email server (also xfinity). Nothing removes the problem message. Is there a way to remove it without removing the whole tbird program (and then reinstalling)? It was such a pain to do this last time around. When you do a normal clean out it doesn't actually remove every element. Going in to find every little thing causes me a lot of effort and stress. This one faulty message is making me give up on tbird altogether. Thanks for your help! Annie
creator: anniesmart

title: Moved emails folders into "account@mail.com" root folder and they all have been deleted
content:
Hello, sorry for the question but I can't solve it alone

My issue : I think my emails have been deleted. Its something like 500mb of content.

I'm on Windows 10; on 128.9.2esr version for Thunderbird.

You see how the path is structured: account@mail.com/inbox/... I moved my mails folders into the folder account@mail.com (instead of account@mail.com/inbox/) Closed thunderbird Restarted thunderbird

All folders at account@mail.com/ disappeared.

I tried to find them. I created a folder named "TestAccountFindThunderbird" I moved account@mail.com/inbox/TestAccountFindThunderbird into account@mail.com/TestAccountFindThunderbird Closed thunderbird Restarted thunderbird "TestAccountFindThunderbird" disappeared as well

and making a research on C:\ drive I managed to find TestAccountFindThunderbird.msf inside the folder at C:\Users\<my_account>\AppData\Local\Temp\MozillaMailnews

At the same place I found also the other things that disappeared from my mail account Health.msf, Apple.msf, Work.msf, Insurances.msf, Bank.msf, ... But they are all .msf files...

I saved them into a backup folder. Then I copy pasted all that content from backup to INBOX.sbd but when I open Thunderbird in a blink they are all removed. I guess its because they are .msf and not actual content.

1) Why when I move a mail folder into account@mail.com/ then the folder disappears/is deleted? 2) Where are my emails? And how do I reimport them? 3) Why do I have traces of them into AppData\Local\Temp\MozillaMailnews?

Thanks in advance
creator: sylvain.schmitt

title: Unified inbox shows 2 identical messages for each on retrieved by IMAP for all 4 of my accounts.
content:
Thunderbird 128.9.1esr (64-bit) [Linux Mint] retrieves messages from my 4 email accounts (2x gMail & 2x Yahoo-based). It then displays each email retrieved TWICE. In the past, Left-Clicking on Unified Inbox | Properties then the [Update] button would "single-up" the list into a 1-for-1 relationship. I then sort my mail MANUALLY into local folders or delete unwanted in order to keep my inbox "zero'd".

After my recent Linux Mint 22.1 update, this no longer works and I need to close and re-open Thunderbird to get any "ghost" messages that I haven't sorted or deleted to disappear.

I am sure that I have something configured incorrectly but I can't seem to find it. None of the 4 accounts is "aware of" or forwarding to or retrieving from any of the others - they are totally independent. Yet I get duplicated emails from all 4. Using Browser-based mail client, none of them have duplicated stuff anywhere that I can find.

What documentation should I provide? Thanks.
creator: TooFatKat

title: donations
content:
I opened Thunderbird and could not get to the inbox or any other folders—it shows only the donations page. This is not okay. I do donate. Not much, not too often, but I do. However, if I open e-mail client and want to use it, then this is not a right moment to asking for donations. Or I should be able to do what I came to do and deal with donations issue later.

If you want users to pay for Thunderbird, it is of course okay, but please let us know in advance, give some time to mull it over and then clear the sheets. It is most inconvenient when this kind of issue is raised when you actually need to do something. And the message is unclear - how often and how much I need to donate (pay) in order to get to use Thunderbird without interruptions?

Thank you in advance and I do like Thunderbird. Just not this approach.

PS. Sorry for my bad English, not native speaker. PPS. Or, maybe this is some error that donations page does not "go away"?
creator: jyri.kolk

title: What happened to virtual identities?
content:
I know this worked in the past and lately, it doesn't anymore. I have multiple domains and many email addresses coming into my account. There was an extension called Virtual Identity, which would fill in the From field with the Original email address that the email was addressed to.

This was no longer needed because the feature was added to the base code. It worked for years and in the last year or two, it stopped working.

For ex, the email was sent to bob@ex.com, but my account identity is fran@frog.com, when I hit reply(all) it should fill in the FROM field with bob@ex.com, not my account identity. This used to work great, but now it just fills in the account identity instead.

To rule out old settings, I started fresh and it still doesn't work.

I do have “Reply from this identity when delivery headers match:” set to *@ex.com and it still doesn't work.

I am currently running 115.18.0 on linux, but this has been over many versions now.

Did they kill this feature?

Thanks.
creator: afunnymonkey

title: Cannot send PDF files since installed latest version of Thunderbird.
content: Went with a new ISP. Thunderbird was not working right. After spending hours trying to get it to work, backed up as instructed, uninstalled and reinstalled the latest version of Thunderbird. Still have problems but the main issue is not being able to send PDF files or even something scanned from my printer. The error message I keep getting is: "There is no email program associated to perform the requested action. Please install an email program or, if one is already installed, create an association in the Default Programs control panel.". I have gone into Default Programs, associated Thunderbird as my email client. Doesn't work. Went into Regedit and double checked that Thunderbird is my email client. Doesn't work. What do I need to do so that my Windows 10 Home PC, Version 22H2 can send PDF files. All other regular emails (in/out) work fine.
creator: md.imailed

title: Constant THurnderbird update
content:
Seems like every week Mozilla does a update to Thunderbird. Every time becomes another problem. Look at all the HELP issues on this forum. There is a old saying " (KISS)KEEP IT SIMPLE STUPID" First my "TRASH" disappeared and it now it goes into the "JUNK" file. Then the "JUNK" icon disappeared and when customized back to the top it no longer worked. I had done away with the password having to constantly being entered EVERY time I to tried to receive or send or even look at a existing email already received. And NOW the demanding a password is back with the last weekly update. Now I am constantly having to put in a password that I deleted from the "SAVED PASSWORD" and no NOT have the blocked checked in the "Use Primary Password".

I wish I could do a complete CLEAN REINSTALL OF THUNDERBIRD BUT EVERY TIME IT STILL SEEMS TO RECOVER THE PREVIOUS VERSION. Any help would be appreciated. <redacted>
creator: dsks

title: non vedo più su thunderbird la cartella locale
content: Ho creato una cartella locale in cui ho smistato alcune pec vecchie; la cartella si chiama archivio pec 2017-2018; a quel punto ho modificato le impostazioni per reindirizzare quanto inserito nella cartella locale su una cartella locale presente su google drive; tuttavia le pec salvate non erano visibili su google drive e su thunder nemmeno la cartella stessa; seguendo una procedura suggerita da openai sono riuscito a vedere che nel roaming folder che c'è traccia di quella cartella archivio pec 2017-2018, ho provato a spostarla su google drive, ma lì non riesco ad aprire nulla in quanto file non visibile in anteprima e se lo scarico poi mi dice che non ho un programma per aprirlo; inoltre non è comunque visibile su thunder. Non so più cosa fare. Alessandro
